UP-AND-DOWN.Definition: having both good and bad times

SPRAWLING.Definition: spreading out over a large area

LAWSUITS.Definition: legal cases brought to a court

CAST.Definition: choose or vote in an election

BALLOTS.Definition: pieces of paper used for voting

EXCEPTIONS.Definition: cases that are different from the usual

GRAPHICS.Definition: pictures or designs used in media

SEEMINGLY.Definition: appearing to be true but not certainly

EXIT POLL.Definition: a survey or study of people leaving a voting place

TRENDS.Definition: general patterns or directions of change

MODELS.Definition: examples or systems used for understanding the data

GLUED.Definition: unable to stop watching or looking at

SCREEN.Definition: the flat part of a TV or computer

TEND TO.Definition: usually do or are likely to

HEAD TO HEAD.Definition: in direct competition with each other, very close

TAKES THE WIND OUT OF THE SAILS.Definition: makes them lose confidence or energy

MORALE-BOOSTING.Definition: making them feel more positive or confident

INHERITED.Definition: received from his father after his death

JEWEL IN THE CROWN.Definition: the best or most valuable part

LEFT-LEANING.Definition: supporting ideas that are more liberal or progressive

FLIPPANT.Definition: not being serious about something important

INTEGRITY.Definition: being honest and having strong moral principles

TIDE MIGHT BE TURNING.Definition: things might be starting to change

PROPAGANDA.Definition: sharing information used to influence opinions

OUTWARDLY.Definition: on the surface or in appearance

CLAIMED.Definition: said that it was true without proof

FAWNED OVER.Definition: praised or admired him too much

COULDN’T GET ENOUGH OF HIM.Definition: liked him very much and wanted more of him

UNPARALLELED.Definition: better or greater than anything else

REFUTE.Definition: prove it was wrong or false

ANCHORS.Definition: TV hosts who presented news programmes

HANDSOMELY.Definition: in a way that gave a lot of money or reward

SUCCESSION.Definition: the process of one person taking over a role after another

IN THE RUNNING.Definition: being considered as a possible choice

PRAGMATIST.Definition: someone who focussed on practical solutions

ALIENATING.Definition: making them feel abandoned or unwanted

GOLDEN GOOSE.Definition: something that brought a lot of money or success

POLARISING.Definition: causing people to split into two opposing groups

ABANDONING.Definition: leaving or giving up on them

BASE.Definition: a group of people who strongly supported it

UNPREDICTABLE.Definition: difficult to guess or foresee his behaviour

STATUS QUO.Definition: the current situation or way things were

AFTERMATH.Definition: the consequences or after-effects the event

DISPLEASURE.Definition: a feeling of being unhappy or annoyed

TUNED IN.Definition: watched or listened to the TV shows

DILEMMA.Definition: a difficult choice between two options

APPEASE.Definition: calm or please him by giving him what he wanted

LAWSUIT.Definition: a legal case brought to a court

DEFAMATION.Definition: saying something false that damaged their reputation

DAMAGES.Definition: money awarded as compensation for harm or loss

ANCHOR.Definition: a TV presenter who leads a news programme

MOCKING.Definition: making fun of them in a mean way

SETTLEMENT.Definition: agreement to end the disagreement in court

CLAIMS.Definition: saying or statements that it was true, without proof

USHER IN.Definition: introduce or mark the start of

CHARISMA.Definition: a special charm or ability to attract others

TRY AS HE MIGHT.Definition: even though he tried very hard

NOMINEE.Definition: the one chosen for the position

CASH COW.Definition: something that makes a lot of money

MIRACLES.Definition: amazing events or achievements that seem impossible

MUTUALLY.Definition: shared by two people or parties
